tag_list: video-discovery, social-tv, personal-tv, movie-recommendations, film, movies, open-source
overview:
Polish Internet entrepreneur, founder, programmer and CEO of Filmaster.TV, a video recommendation engine in the cloud. Film buff and computer geek.

He graduated from PJIIT with a software engineering degree in 2005. Before starting his own ventures, he worked as a programmer, technical project lead and consultant in multiple software houses in Poland, Germany and United Kingdom. In 2007 Borys founded a successful startup OSnews.pl, now the Polish leader of citizen IT journalism. In 2011 he co-founded Reaktor Warsaw, a Silicon-Valley-like startup mansion located in the green part of Warsaw, where Filmaster is based together with 10+ other startups.

Borys is a longtime activist for net neutrality and open standards in Poland and Europe. His petition against net censorship signed by almost 100k Internet users triggered the prime minister to speak publicly about the issue and eventually withdraw the legislation.

His favorite movie is Jim Jarmush’s “Dead man” and his favorite book is “The Futurological Congress” by Stanislaw Lem.
